bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 61 (Monday, April 10, 2023)][House][Pages H1718-H1719]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LYNCH:H.R. 2565.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H1719]]Article I, Section VIII, Clause XVIIIThe single subject of this legislation is:This bill will direct the Administrator of the FederalAviation Administration to establish an advisory committeefor communities impacted by aviation.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text:
This bill directs the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to establish an Impacted Communities Advisory Committee. The committee must provide advice and recommendations to the FAA on community needs, plans, and strategies with respect to areas that include

  • noise policy;
  • community engagement;
  • noise, pollution, and health mitigation for communities close to airports and communities away from airports; and
  • integration of new or emerging technologies.

bill.title: To direct the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to establish an advisory committee for communities impacted by aviation, and for other purposes.

To direct the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to establish an advisory committee for communities impacted by aviation, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
